member.summary: Represents the endpoint to which control messages are directed.

member.summary: Provides facilities to allocate and name endpoints.

member.summary: Gets a pseudo-singleton instance.

member.name: T:GOLDi.Fabric.Infrastructure.ILink
member.summary: Defines the interface for accessing the GOLDi Bus at message level.

member.name: P:GOLDi.Fabric.Infrastructure.ILink.IncomingMessages
member.summary: Provides a stream of incoming messages.

member.name: M:GOLDi.Fabric.Infrastructure.ILink.Post(GOLDi.Fabric.Messages.IMessage)
member.summary: Queue a message for sending. There are no garanties for the message ordering. This call ist thread-safe.

member.name: M:GOLDi.Fabric.Infrastructure.IRoutableLink.IsConnectable(GOLDi.Fabric.Infrastructure.Endpoint)
member.summary: Check whether a given endpoint could be attached to this link.

member.name: M:GOLDi.Fabric.Infrastructure.IRoutableLink.IsConnected(GOLDi.Fabric.Infrastructure.Endpoint)
member.summary: Check whether the endpoint is currently attached to this link.

member.name: T:GOLDi.Fabric.Infrastructure.ISynchronizedLink
member.summary: Provides synchronization facilities for GOLDi Bus access. Communication with individual endpoints can be locked to allow exclusive access.

member.name: P:GOLDi.Fabric.Infrastructure.ISynchronizedLink.BackgroundTransfer
member.summary: Provides a link to the GOLDi Bus which will queue messages until they can be sent. Locks aquired by will prevent immediate delivery and filter incoming messages.

member.name: M:GOLDi.Fabric.Infrastructure.ISynchronizedLink.HasAccess(GOLDi.Fabric.Infrastructure.Endpoint)
member.summary: Check whether the current link has access to the given endpoint.
member.param: Endpoint which should be checked for exclusive access.

member.name: M:GOLDi.Fabric.Infrastructure.ISynchronizedLink.RequestExclusiveAccessAsync(GOLDi.Fabric.Infrastructure.Endpoint,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Request exclusive access to a single endpoint. The function returns when the endpoint locks was successfully aquired.
member.param: Cancellation token to abort the wait for the reservation.
member.returns: Link with exclusive access to the given endpoint, which must be disposed to release the lock. It can only communicate with the set endpoint.

member.name: M:GOLDi.Fabric.Infrastructure.ISynchronizedLink.RequestExclusiveAccessAsync(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{GOLDi.Fabric.Infrastructure.Endpoint},System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Request exclusive access to a number of endpoints. The function returns when all endpoint locks were successfully aquired.
member.param: List of all endpoints which require exculse access.
Cancellation token to abort the wait for reservations.
member.returns: Link with exclusive access to the given endpoints, which must be disposed to release the lock.

member.name: M:GOLDi.Fabric.Infrastructure.ISynchronizedLink.TryRequestExclusiveAccess(GOLDi.Fabric.Infrastructure.Endpoint)
member.summary: Try to aquire exclusive access to an endpoint. The atempt fails immediately if the device is already locked.
member.returns: If the request failed, is returned. Otherwise a link with exclusive access to the given endpoint is returned, which must be disposed to release the lock. It can only communicate with the set endpoint.

member.name: T:GOLDi.Fabric.Messages.MessagePropertyAttribute
member.summary: Labels a property in a class inheriting from as relevant debugging information.

member.name: T:GOLDi.Fabric.Messages.Attributes.BCDAttribute
member.summary: Labels a field inside a message layout definition as BCD-encoded.

member.name: T:GOLDi.Fabric.Messages.Attributes.BigEndianAttribute
member.summary: Interpret raw incoming message as a big-endian bit vector with padding in the least significant bits.

member.name: T:GOLDi.Fabric.Messages.Attributes.BindingAttribute
member.summary: Binds a constructor parameter to a specific field or property in the layout.

member.name: T:GOLDi.Fabric.Messages.Attributes.BitRangeAttribute
member.summary:
This is a positional attribute which selects a contiguous range of bits.
When multiple positional attributes are applied to a single member, the first one will locate the most significant bits, while the last one describes the least significant bits.
All positional attributes used in a layout class must describe pairwise disjoint bit selections.

member.name: T:GOLDi.Fabric.Messages.Attributes.BitsAttribute
member.summary:
This is a positional attribute which selects single bits by their index.
When multiple positional attributes are applied to a single member, the first one will locate the most significant bits, while the last one describes the least significant bits.
All positional attributes used in a layout class must describe pairwise disjoint bit selections.

member.name: T:GOLDi.Fabric.Messages.Attributes.ByteRangeAttribute
member.summary:
This is a positional attribute which selects a contiguous range of bytes.
When multiple positional attributes are applied to a single member, the first one will locate the most significant bits, while the last one describes the least significant bits.
All positional attributes used in a layout class must describe pairwise disjoint bit selections.

member.name: T:GOLDi.Fabric.Messages.Attributes.BytesAttribute
member.summary:
This is a positional attribute which selects bytes by their index.
When multiple positional attributes are applied to a single member, the first one will locate the most significant bits, while the last one describes the least significant bits.
All positional attributes used in a layout class must describe pairwise disjoint bit selections.

member.name: T:GOLDi.Fabric.Messages.Attributes.DefaultBindingAttribute
member.summary: Indicate that default binding should take place on the specified parameter or all parameters of the constructor. Default binding will try to case-insensitively find equaly named members of the layout and use their values. If that fails, binding by type to the provided default values (usually packet source or packet flow, creation timestamp) will take place.

member.name: T:GOLDi.Fabric.Messages.Attributes.FormatAttribute
member.summary: Specify a format for the layout. The format is used to differentiate between different bus systems.

member.name: T:GOLDi.Fabric.Messages.Attributes.InvariantAttribute
member.summary: Signals that the layout the member is defined in is only applicable if the original message object contains a property with the same name and value.

member.name: T:GOLDi.Fabric.Messages.Attributes.LayoutAttribute
member.summary: Provides a reference to a layout that can be used to serialize and deserialize the message.

member.name: T:GOLDi.Fabric.Messages.Attributes.LengthAttribute
member.summary: Provides the length of the message in bytes.

member.name: T:GOLDi.Fabric.Messages.Attributes.LittleEndianAttribute
member.summary: Interpret raw incoming message as a little-endian bit vector.

member.summary: Load all objects with layouts from all assemblies in the current app domain. Additinally, when another assembly is loaded, its defined objects will also be loaded.

member.summary: Provides a fragment of the name of a device, which is a string representation of its type. This message is a reply to a .

member.summary: This message is a reply to a and contains the read data.

member.summary: This out-of-band message indicates a protection violation detected by an SPU.

member.name: P:GOLDi.Fabric.Messages.ServiceMessages.ErrorCodeMessage.Code
member.summary: Contains the ID of the error that was detected.

member.name: P:GOLDi.Fabric.Messages.ServiceMessages.ErrorCodeMessage.Counter
member.summary: If multiple errors occured at once, it contains an increasing number starting at zero for the messages belonging to each other.

member.name: P:GOLDi.Fabric.Messages.ServiceMessages.ErrorCodeMessage.IsTimeoutError
member.summary: Indicates whether the error was caused by a timeout or a control exception.

member.summary: Trigger a hardware reset.
